security_audit.summary: All static findings were evaluated as false positives. The skill safely fetches public guidelines from a trusted GitHub URL. No dangerous patterns present.

medium_findings.title: Markdown Backtick Formatting Misidentified
medium_findings.description: Static scanner flagged Markdown backticks (`file:line`) as Ruby/shell backtick execution. This is false positive - backticks are used for code formatting in documentation.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks are standard Markdown syntax for inline code. No shell or Ruby execution occurs.

medium_findings.title: Git SHA Pattern Misidentified
medium_findings.description: Static scanner flagged Git SHA in SYNC.md as 'weak cryptographic algorithm'. Git SHAs are version control hashes, not encryption.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Git SHAs are SHA-1 hashes used for integrity verification, not cryptographic algorithms for encryption.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URL for Guidelines Fetch
low_findings.description: Skill fetches guidelines from hardcoded GitHub URL. This is intentional design for retrieving latest rules.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Read-only fetch from trusted vercel-labs GitHub repository. Core functionality, low risk.

content.user_title: Review Web UI Design Against Guidelines
content.value_statement: Check your web UI against Vercel's official accessibility and design guidelines. Get immediate feedback on semantic HTML, focus states, forms, animations, typography, images, and more.
actual_capabilities: Fetch and apply Vercel's official Web Interface Guidelines
Review files for semantic HTML compliance
Check focus states and accessibility controls
Validate form inputs, labels, and error handling
Check typography and content handling practices
Verify image optimization and lazy loading
Evaluate touch interactions and layout best practices
limitations: Only reviews UI against Vercel's specific guidelines
Cannot check backend API logic or server-side code
Limited to web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Does not test actual page rendering or user behavior
Cannot validate against other accessibility standards (WCAG levels)

use_cases.title: Accessibility Audit
use_cases.description: Check if your website meets Vercel's accessibility standards for semantic HTML, focus states, forms, and screen reader support.

use_cases.title: Design System Review
use_cases.description: Review UI components against official guidelines for typography, spacing, colors, and dark mode implementation.

use_cases.title: Code Review Assistant
use_cases.description: Automatically identify anti-patterns and violations in web UI code during pull request reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Basic UI Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the following files against Vercel's Web Interface Guidelines and report any violations in file:line format:

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check these files for accessibility compliance with Vercel's guidelines. Focus on semantic HTML, focus states, form accessibility, and ARIA usage.

prompt_templates.title: Design Pattern Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit these UI components against Vercel's design guidelines. Report anti-patterns and suggest improvements for typography, spacing, and animations.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Guidelines Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all files against the complete Web Interface Guidelines. Check all categories including focus states, forms, images, dark mode, and performance practices.

faq.question: What guidelines does this skill check against?
faq.answer: This skill checks against Vercel's Web Interface Guidelines, which cover semantic HTML, focus states, form accessibility, animations, typography, images, dark mode, and more.

faq.question: Does this skill test actual page rendering?
faq.answer: No, this skill reviews code statically against guidelines. It does not render pages or test user behavior in a browser.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-web projects?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). It is not designed for native mobile apps, desktop applications, or backend code.

faq.question: How often are guidelines updated?
faq.answer: The skill fetches the latest guidelines from GitHub on each use, ensuring you always apply current best practices.

faq.question: Does this check WCAG compliance?
faq.answer: It checks against Vercel's guidelines which align with accessibility best practices. It does not validate against specific WCAG levels or produce WCAG compliance reports.

faq.question: What file types can be reviewed?
faq.answer: The skill works with web code files including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSX, TypeScript, and similar formats used in web development.
